definition: to leap up/(coll.) to gush out/to spurt out
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
lit. to leap the house and cross the roofridge (idiom); dashing over rooftops (of robbers and pursuing knight-errant 俠客|侠客 in fiction)
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously/also written 抱頭鼠竄|抱头鼠窜

sentences.english: They shall run to and fro in the city; they shall run upon the wall, they shall climb up upon the houses; they shall enter in at the windows like a thief.
sentences.chinese: 他們蹦上城，躥上牆，爬上房屋，進入窗戶如同盜賊。
他的鼻子被人打得躥血了。

sentences.english: He set a match to the gas stove and the flames burst out.
sentences.chinese: 他擦了根火柴點燃了煤氣爐，火焰躥了出來。

sentences.english: The trainer is training the tiger to leap over obstacles.
sentences.chinese: 馴獸員在馴練老虎躥越障礙。

sentences.english: Dad opened the door and the cat shot in, with the dog after it.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸打開門，貓就躥進來，後面還跟着狗。

sentences.english: I need to be been returning to in front, but being come out by a snake Cuan to stun.
sentences.chinese: 我待要回前頭，卻被一條蛇躥出來嚇昏了。

sentences.english: They basely fly and dare not stay the field.
sentences.chinese: 便四下裏亂逃亂躥，不敢再留在戰場上。

sentences.english: behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.
A cold tingle of fear ran through Karen as she took it all in.
sentences.chinese: 當凱倫回想起時，一種冰冷刺痛的恐懼躥上她全身。

sentences.english: Then in one bound he reached the top of the wall and vanished from their sight.
sentences.chinese: 於是它一跳便躥上牆頭，消失了，她們看不見它了。

sentences.english: At this time has been dispersed, however they will then leapt out unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 此時已經散去，然而它們定然會再躥出來攻其不備。

sentences.english: A snake darted out of the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 一條蛇嗖地從灌木叢中躥了出來。

definition: to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to soar/to rise high into the air
to shake off/to get rid of
